page.title: 06PRIMARY & NURSERY EDUCATION
page.content: (contd. from page 5) With the drop in school rolls some of these schools have extra space now. Others (e.g. Lasswade Primary) which is in a very popular catchment area, have the problem of overcrowding. Parents have the right to send their children to the school of their choice. The primary school{curriculum is divided into these main areas, {Language, Mathematics, Enviromental {Studies, Expressive Arts, and Social, {Moral and Religious Education.}Pupils are encouraged to learn through activity and discovery methods. There is ample provision for the under fives in {nursery schools}and {playgroups,}so that the very young child, whose parents so desire, may have the benefit of the stimulatory environment which these places provide.
